intro: Zeuxine hengchuanense, commonly known as the Hengchuan zeuxine, is a flowering plant species native to China. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other showy wildflowers. The plant is characterized by its delicate, herbaceous stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
